mc_movie_name: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Dog Days

mc_pro_critic_reviews.summary: Though often self-centered and conniving, Greg remains a likable kid, and the movie entertains by pulling off over-the-top scenarios that set up digestible life lessons for youngsters.
It really captures what it feels like to be a kid.
It's the latest installment in what now forms a lightly likable trilogy of films based on Jeff Kinney's Wimpy Kid books.
Fox is smart to keep turning this stuff out before star Gordon grows too old for the role. He's terrific in a Leave it to Beaver way, perfectly capturing the angst of being in-betweener.
Oroves nimbler and truer to its origins than last year's "Rodrick Rules."
Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Dog Days is probably the most inoffensive kid's film you're likely to see this summer. And that's a good thing.
Genial and pleasant to a fault, the film could benefit from a little more personality.
Maintains the franchise's knack for getting kids right.
Viewers enduring early adolescence or those grappling with its psychic scars will recognize the honesty in the comic humiliation.

Director David Bowers' story is straightforwardly -- almost unimaginatively -- approached. But, armed with a talented cast and Kinney's chuckle-generating source material, it functions nicely as a sort of big-screen "Wonder Years" for Millennials.
It's perfectly workable popcorn entertainment for the school holidays.
The best of the lot. It's not great, but the mean-spiritedness that permeated the first film and stuck around a bit for the second is mostly gone.

Formulaic in adhering to the sitcom-style tone of the first two films, picture  finds the chronically underappreciated Greg facing a summer break replete with parental expectations and anxiety over his first crush.
Greg avoids the curse of the three in the third outing for the Wimpy Kid. Hardly groundbreaking but plenty of fun for its target audience.
Childminders rejoice: the formulaic but family-friendly series is back and it's business as usual.
Ends the series' winning streak, or at least slows it down to a panting, dog-day crawl.

The film is more a patched-together collection of anecdotes than a coherent story, and some of Greg's tribulations, like fear over a high dive and an amusement-park ride, don't seem age-appropriate for a boy who has just finished seventh grade.
Compared to the first two movie installments, this one is uncharacteristically scattershot in the life-lessons department.
A half-hearted morality tale about taking responsibility for your actions as a sign of impending maturity.

Unlike last year's superior "Judy Moody and the Not Bummer Summer" - which put its grade-school heroine through similarly seasonal woes - "Dog Days" squanders several chances to find something magical in the mundane.
Here and there, in the father/son scenes, you see a glimmer of an honest interaction. All in all, I'd rather watch a "Ned's Declassified School Survival Guide" rerun.
I'd call Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Dog Days harmless if it weren't for some totally unnecessary gay-panic jokes that could actually encourage bullying.

mc_user_reviews.text: The best of the Wimpy Kid movies. I was smiling and laughing throughout the entire movie. It's hilarious and brings several life lessons for kids to the table. The cast, as always, did a fantastic job. If you enjoyed the other Diary of a Wimpy Kid movies you'll enjoy this. Hilarious and one of the best movies of the year.
The best of the three! Dog Days delivers much more of a sentimental lesson but still pushing in the vast amount of fun and awesomeness the series needs.

At first I didn't like the Wimpy Kid films at all and when I found out about a third film, I laughed and didn't expect anything from it. But I then watched the 2nd Film on TV and was gripped to the Holly/Greg storyline. This caused me to go and watch the 3rd Film, Dog Days, expecting a cheesy, bad film. However, this film isn't all too bad. It's a light hearted comedy, with some good jokes, some bad jokes, and some copied jokes (There's a scene completely copied off a Mr Bean episode!). But it wasn't too bad. The Holly/Greg story that I was hooked into remained and, although it wasn't completely resolved, they ended the film and the story with finesse. Although I warn you, the opening and ending bits with human Greg standing in front of a cartoon background is the cheesiest thing ever, but you can forget that. Overall It's not the worst film of the year *Cough* Abe Lincoln Vampire Hunter *Cough* but if you are looking for a comedy with great constant gags, It's not the film for you.

By far it is the best of the "Wimpy Kid" movie trilogy. It is at some parts hilarious, but others were very weak and boring. But that is usually what I expect from these movies. You have to give the comedic style some time. Not to spoil, but the ending is hilarious. I was also really scared to death (honestly, during a PG movie!) during one part.
i found this film terrible . you have a dad who is retarded a mom who is overprotected and brother who is cool but messes with your head . wow this trilogy is a waste of time
The Movie is the best than the last two movies.The Movie still have those problems like it's predecessors but  still manages to have the word "Fun" in it.

This movie was awesome! The best of the three Diary of a Wimpy Kid movies. The storyline was good. The characters were great. There were some hilarious parts. The acting was well done. Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Dog Days is a great movie. If you hate Wimpy Kid, you are silly as JB. I'd recommend you watch it.
the best of the three. was so funny and greg is still very good. better than the dark knihght rises big time and its the best of 2012. good graphics and good acting. this is a graet movie
Honestly This Movie In My Opinion Is Trash... Boring And Uncreative..

If this really is the end of this film franchise, then I say it ended on a pretty high note. Its all the same wacky and witty humor of the first 2, but this time its during the summer. You see Greg getting in  embarrasing and troublesome situations a lot more this time around. Yes, this wimpy kid wants to play video games all summer, but his dad tries to change that. That is one big plot point. His relationship with his dad. Anyways, it is not the best of the series (Rodrick Rules is) but it is one heck of a fun conclusion.

Has to be the best out of the 3! Hilarious, and when you see the bond between Greg and Holly starting to grow, it feels great! Especially loved the end - no spoilers here. Want to watch it? Go ahead! It will have you in stitches. Excellent cast too!

The three Wimpy Kid films don't all manage to shock or put true emotions in them, but still manages a handful of laughs and has plot that is true to its book franchise. With family in mind, the film displays once again a humorous typical family facing troubles and going through another adventure in every day life. With this in find, kids will love these scenarios, which adults a little bored, but interested at times.

I still remember being in shock when I heard that the "Diary of a Wimpy Kid" film series was skipping "The Last Straw" and just directly adapting "Dog Days." That said, I was still interested in seeing the film, considering that it was released while I was still a gigantic fan of the books. While I'm not sure if it's better or worse than "Rodrick Rules," I can safely say "Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Dog Days" is still an entertaining romp. It's often quite funny, it stays relatively true to the book, and it's pretty well-acted. It probably won't win the series any new fans, but for the already-converted, it's a fun little diversion and a good time at the movies.

This movie is not really like "dog days", it's more like "the last straw" and "dog days" mixed together. Anyway the acting is cheesy, some of the things in the movie don't happen in the book, and the tattoo. More about the tattoo, it didn't even stay on Rodrick's body when he went in the pool, it ran. You could clearly tell it was make up, cheap make up.
this is the worst of the dairy of the wimpy kid movie but it's not bad. a glad that did not make the last straw whisk is the worst book. not bad but not good.

Are we like getting more installments or that's just it? The books have way more than Dog Days and if you want money, then take your time and make a good Wimpy Kid movie. Say hello to Dog Days, wimpy kids.
While i do think its wise to end the series at this point, it still remains a solid movie that ends the series with a well deserved ending, while still remaing relatable.

Yea, the film continue being some kind of pointless as the originals, that tries to be a "good friend" of the bestsellers. Anyway, Diary of a wimpy kid III: Dog days is truly funny, full of great stunts, with enjoyable story-telling and correct following of the original book, despite the wrong name and some simple cliches.
Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Dog Days is the worst of the three movies and it still is mediocre and easy forgettable but it is harmless and fine for kids to watch.

name: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Dog Days
